Package model.stock

Class SimpleStock

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.stock.SimpleStock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stock
    public class SimpleStock
extends java.lang.Object
implements Stock
    This SimpleStock object is a simple implementation. Of the SimpleStockModel.Stock interface. It is used to store the stock information of a given stock. This implementation relies on the OODStocks class to manage the stocks that have been created. The OODStocks class used is a singleton class that manages the stocks that have been created. It is used to ensure that multiple instances of the same stock are not created. It also handles API calls to get stock information and stores the information in a file. Stock creation is reliant on the downloaded info in the StockInfo folder, WHICH MUST BE IN THIS DIRECTORY.

      • stockInfo

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleStock

        public SimpleStock​(java.lang.String tckr)
            throws StockAlreadyExistsException
        Constructs a SimpleStock object, if the stock has not already been created. By using OODStocks to manage already made stocks, we are able to ensure that multiple of the same stock are not made. When this constructor is called and a SimpleStock is successfully returned it, is automatically added to the stocks static field in OODStocks.
        Parameters:
        tckr - the ticker symbol of the stock, used to identify the stock
        Throws:
        StockAlreadyExistsException - if the stock has already been created, and is stored in the OODStocks singleton class.

    • Method Detail

      • gainLoss

        public double gainLoss​(java.time.LocalDate fromDate,
                       java.time.LocalDate toDate)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Stock
        Allows for examining the gain or loss between two dates for this stock. The calculation will use the closing value of the fromDate as the value that will be compared to the toDate closing price. Note: This calculation does not take into account any days in-between and including each date in which data does not exist for this stock.
        Specified by:
        gainLoss in interface Stock
        Parameters:
        fromDate - the lower bound date to calculate the gain/loss, this value will be used as the starting point for the calculation.
        toDate - the upper bound date to calculate the gain/loss, this value will be used as the ending point for the calculation.
        Returns:
        the difference between the startDate (closing price) and the endDate(closing price)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either of the dates don't exist for this stock.

      • xDayAvg

        public double xDayAvg​(java.time.LocalDate startDate,
                      int days)
               throws java.time.DateTimeException
        Description copied from interface: Stock
        Calculates the x-day moving average. The x-day moving average is the average of the last x days (starting from the given date). Note: this corresponds to the last x days when the stock prices are available. If the given date is valid and the last x days go beyond validate dates for the given stock, will just calculate the average of the available days.
        Specified by:
        xDayAvg in interface Stock
        Parameters:
        startDate - the start date to begin calculating from.
        days - the past x days from the given starting date.
        Returns:
        the moving average of the past x days from the given starting date.
        Throws:
        java.time.DateTimeException

      • defDayCrossover

        public java.util.HashSet<java.time.LocalDate> defDayCrossover​(java.time.LocalDate fromDate,
                                                              java.time.LocalDate toDate)
                                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Stock
        Returns the dates where the 30-day moving average is lower than the closing price, Between the given dates. (see xDayAvg() for more information on the moving average) Note for implementation: date ranges can be easily checked by using the compareTo method of the LocalDate class.
        Specified by:
        defDayCrossover in interface Stock
        Parameters:
        fromDate - the end date to stop checking for crossovers. (must be less than or equal to the start date)
        toDate - the start date to begin checking for crossovers. (must be greater than or equal to the end date)
        Returns:
        unique dates in which the x-day moving average crosses the closing price .
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given from and to date are not within the start and end date of this stock.

      • xDayCrossover

        public java.util.HashSet<java.time.LocalDate> xDayCrossover​(java.time.LocalDate fromDate,
                                                            java.time.LocalDate toDate,
                                                            int days)
        Description copied from interface: Stock
        Returns the dates that the x-day moving average is lower than the closing price, in between the given start and end dates. (see xDayAvg() for more information on the moving average) Note for implementation: date ranges can be easily checked by using the compareTo method of the LocalDate class.
        Specified by:
        xDayCrossover in interface Stock
        Parameters:
        fromDate - the end date to stop checking for crossovers. (must be less than or equal to the start date)
        toDate - the start date to begin checking for crossovers. (must be greater than or equal to the end date)
        days - the days to calculate the xDayAvg to check against
        Returns:
        unique dates where the x-day moving average crosses the closing price for this stock.
